description: This course examines the features of modern operating systems, including detailed
consideration of Linux and other example systems.  Projects range from system-level
programming and multithreaded network programming to kernel modifications.  Topics
include operating system principles, implementation as system calls, process scheduling
and dispatch, concurrency, inter-process communication, programming with threads and sockets,
device management, file systems, security and protection mechanisms, virtual machines, and kernel
programming. Offered alternate years. Prerequisites: completion
of or concurrent enrollment in CSCI 241 and CSCI 251, or permission of instructor.
